verses.text: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, \add even\add* as unto babes in Christ.
I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able \add to bear it\add*, neither yet now are ye able.
For ye are yet carnal: for whereas \add there is\add* among you envying, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?
For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I \add am\add* of Apollos; are ye not carnal?
Who then is Paul, and who \add is\add* Apollos, but ministers by whom ye believed, even as the Lord gave to every man?
I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.
So then neither is he that planteth any \add thing\add*, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.
Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.
For we are labourers together with God: ye are God’s husbandry, \add ye are\add* God’s building.
According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another buildeth thereon. But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.
For other foundation can no \add man\add* lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.
Now if any \add man\add* build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble;
every man’s work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare \add it\add*, because it shall be revealed by fire; and the fire shall try every man’s work of what sort it is.
If any \add man’s\add* work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.
If any \add man’s\add* work shall be burnt, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.
Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and \add that\add* the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
If any \add man\add* defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, which \add temple\add* ye are.
Let no \add man\add* deceive himself. If any \add man\add* among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.
For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.
And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.
Therefore let no \add man\add* glory in men. For all \add things\add* are yours;
whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or \add things\add* present, or \add things\add* to come; all are yours;
and ye \add are\add* Christ’s; and Christ \add is\add* God’s.
